dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 562 IH: VRAP Extension Act of 2013
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Miller of Florida introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To provide for a three-month extension of the Veterans Retraining Assistance Program administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the VRAP Extension Act of 2013.

section.header: Three-month extension of Veterans Retraining Assistance Program

subsection.text: Section 211 of the VOW to Hire Heroes Act of 2011 (Public Law 112–56; 125 Stat. 713; 38 U.S.C. 4100 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)(2)(B), by striking March 31, 2014 and inserting June 30, 2014; and
in subsection (k), by striking March 31, 2014 and inserting June 30, 2014.

Not later than 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, in collaboration with the Secretary of Labor, shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress an interim report on the retraining assistance provided under section 211 of the VOW to Hire Heroes Act of 2011 (Public Law 112–56; 125 Stat. 713; 38 U.S.C. 4100 note).
The report required by paragraph (1) shall include the following:

clause.text: eligible veterans who have participated in the program established under such section as of the date of the enactment of this Act; and

associates degrees or certificates awarded (or other similar evidence of the completion of the program of education or training earned) to veterans participating in the program established under such section as of such date.

subparagraph.text: Data related to the employment status of eligible veterans who participated in such program.
